title: Ticket #375: docs for crondor
description:
The Crondor documentation "CronTab Scheduling" could use some improvements:

  1. Should we mention at least in passing (and the index) that this is sometimes known as "crondor." That's what we call it in house, and we almost certainly call it that sometimes in public.

  2. The various knobs (cron_minute, cron_hour, cron_day_of_Month, cron_month, cron_day_of_week, and probably others) don't link from the index to this section. They currently only link to the condor_submit man page. Add these index entries.

  3. Semantics for CronTab Specification "cron_day_of_Month" should be "cron_day_of_month" (appears in one of the tables)

  4. Semantics for CronTab Specification "The day will be the logical or of both [cron_day_of_month and cron_day_of_week]." This is likely true... unless one of the two, but not both, is set to "* ". In that case, the "* " is probably discarded and treated as an empty set. If this was not the case, setting "cron_day_of_week=1" would run on every single day. This needs to be checked before changing.

  5. Preparation Time and Execution Window There are two examples which set "cron_hour = * " then claim "The job is scheduled to begin execution at the top of every hour." This is incorrect. The resulting job will run every minute. Replacing "cron_hour=* " with "cron_minute=0" will accomplish what is desired.
